document_title: Thyroid cancer: Causes, diagnosis, common complications
subsection_content:
Thyroid cancer is divided into two groups: differentiated thyroid cancer and undifferentiated thyroid cancer.
Differentiated thyroid cancer accounts for about 90%, this group progresses slowly, has good prognosis, and includes:
Papillary thyroid carcinoma.; Follicular thyroid carcinoma.; Combined papillary and follicular thyroid carcinoma.
The undifferentiated thyroid cancer group accounts for about 10%, this group progresses quickly and metastasizes quickly, including:
Medullary thyroid carcinoma.; Undifferentiated thyroid carcinoma.
See more: 4 stages of thyroid cancer: How to evaluate and diagnose in detail.
